div1.head: Military Orders for Aristides Agramonte, June 27, 1900
div1.p: FROM THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES Vol 175 A 1900

Adjutant General's
OFFICE.
JUL 7 1900
ROLLS DIVISION

ORDERS, BOOKS, BLANKS &
A. G. O.
RECD. JUL 2 1900

HEADQUARTERS DIVISION OF CUBA,
Havana, June 27, 1900.

1. In compliance with paragraph 3, Special Orders No.
145, current series, Headquarters of the Army, the Quar-
termaster's Department will furnish the necessary trans-
portation from this city to Fort Ontario, New York, via
New Orleans, Louisiana, for Post Quartermaster Sergeant
Peter N. Merzig, now in this city.

The Subsistence Department will commute his rations,
in advance, for three (3) days, at the usual rate, it being
impracticable for this soldier to carry rations of any kind
for that part of the journey performed by rail.

Sergeant Merzig is permitted to delay en route twenty
(20) days in order to attend to the business referred to in
the order from Headquarters of the Army above quoted.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

2. Major Edwin St. J. Greble, Assistant Adjutant Gen-
eral, U. S. Volunteers, will proceed to Remedios, Cuba,
and inspect the charitable institutions at that point, such
as hospitals and prisons; he is also authorized to visit, for
the purpose of inspection, charitable institutions in the
neighboring towns en route, if he deems such visits neces-
sary, and upon the completion of the duty assigned him
will return to his proper station, Havana, Cuba.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

3. Acting Assistant Surgeon Aristides Agramonte, U. S.
Army, will proceed to Santa Clara, Cuba, on sanitary duty,
and upon completion of the same will return to his proper
station, Havana, Cuba.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.
BY COMMAND OF MAJOR GENERAL WOOD:

H. L. SCOTT,
Acting Adjutant General.
